title: Matthew Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Matthew chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Matthew Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Matthew Chapter 10.

questions.question: Who did Jesus call and give power against unclean spirits in Matthew 10?
questions.correctAnswer: His twelve disciples
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:1 states that Jesus called his twelve disciples and gave them power against unclean spirits.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the twelve apostles named in Matthew 10?
questions.correctAnswer: Paul
questions.explanation: Paul is not listed among the twelve apostles in Matthew 10:2-4; the others are named there.

questions.question: To whom did Jesus command the twelve apostles NOT to go?
questions.correctAnswer: Gentiles and Samaritans
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:5 says Jesus instructed them not to go to Gentiles or any city of the Samaritans.

questions.question: What message were the twelve apostles to preach as they went out?
options: The kingdom of heaven is at hand
questions.correctAnswer: The kingdom of heaven is at hand
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:7 instructs the apostles to preach that the kingdom of heaven is near.

questions.question: What did Jesus tell the apostles to do freely as they had freely received?
options: Heal the sick and cast out devils
questions.correctAnswer: Heal the sick and cast out devils
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:8 commands them to heal, cleanse, raise the dead, and cast out devils freely.

questions.question: What were the apostles instructed NOT to take with them on their journey?
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, or brass
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:9 instructs them not to provide gold, silver, or brass in their purses.

questions.question: What should the apostles do when they enter a city or town according to Matthew 10?
options: Enquire who is worthy and stay there
questions.correctAnswer: Enquire who is worthy and stay there
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:11 tells them to find a worthy person and stay in their house until they leave.

questions.question: What should the apostles do if a house or city does not receive them or hear their words?
options: Shake off the dust from their feet
questions.correctAnswer: Shake off the dust from their feet
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:14 instructs them to shake off the dust from their feet as a testimony against that place.

questions.question: In Matthew 10, how are the apostles described as being sent forth in the midst of what?
questions.correctAnswer: Sheep among wolves
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:16 describes them as sheep among wolves, and they are told to be wise and harmless.

questions.question: What will happen to those who endure to the end, according to Matthew 10?
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be saved
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:22 promises that those who endure persecution to the end will be saved.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus told His disciples to fear those who can kill the body but cannot kill the soul.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:28 says not to fear those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul, but to fear God who can destroy both.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 10, Jesus came to send peace on earth.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:34 says Jesus did not come to send peace but a sword, signaling division.

questions.question: True or False: Matthew 10 teaches that a disciple is above his master.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:24 says the disciple is not above the master.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'He that findeth his life shall ____ it; and he that loseth his life for my sake shall find it.'
questions.correctAnswer: lose
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:39 states that he who finds his life shall lose it, but he who loses it for Jesus' sake will find it.

questions.question: Complete this instruction from Matthew 10:27: 'What I tell you in darkness, that speak ye in ____, and what ye hear in the ear, that preach ye upon the housetops.'
questions.correctAnswer: light
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:27 instructs to speak openly ('in light') what was told in darkness.

medium.title: Matthew Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Matthew Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is anxious about how to witness boldly. Based on Matthew 10, what biblical truth would you share about speaking under pressure?
options: The Spirit will speak through you in the moment of need
You must prepare a speech in advance
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit will speak through you in the moment of need
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:19-20 teaches that when delivered up, believers should not worry about what to say because the Spirit of the Father will speak through them. This encourages reliance on God's guidance rather than self-preparation.

questions.question: How does Matthew 10 instruct believers to handle material provisions when going out to preach?
options: Do not take gold, silver, or brass in your purses
questions.correctAnswer: Do not take gold, silver, or brass in your purses
questions.explanation: Verses 9-10 command the disciples not to carry money or extra supplies, teaching trust in God's provision and the hospitality of others during ministry.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with fear of persecution. What encouragement does Matthew 10 offer about fear and God’s care?
options: Fear not, you are of more value than many sparrows
questions.correctAnswer: Fear not, you are of more value than many sparrows
questions.explanation: Verses 29-31 emphasize God's intimate care, noting sparrows' value and that God knows even the hairs on your head, thus encouraging believers to trust Him over fear.

questions.question: How does Matthew 10 teach believers to respond when their message is rejected in a city or house?
options: Shake off the dust of your feet as a testimony
questions.correctAnswer: Shake off the dust of your feet as a testimony
questions.explanation: Verse 14 instructs believers to shake off the dust from their feet when rejected, symbolizing a separation from those who refuse the Gospel, while maintaining peace.

questions.question: What does Matthew 10 say about the value of confessing Christ before others?
options: Whoever confesses Christ will be confessed before the Father
Keep faith private to avoid persecution
questions.correctAnswer: Whoever confesses Christ will be confessed before the Father
questions.explanation: Verse 32 promises that those who confess Jesus before men will be acknowledged before God, highlighting the importance of public faith as an act of obedience and trust.

questions.question: A believer wonders about the cost of following Jesus. What does Matthew 10 teach about loving family compared to loving Christ?
options: Loving father or mother more than Christ makes one unworthy
Faith has no conflict with family love
questions.correctAnswer: Loving father or mother more than Christ makes one unworthy
questions.explanation: Verse 37 clarifies that devotion to Christ surpasses family ties, emphasizing the priority of faith even when it causes relational challenges.

questions.question: How does Matthew 10 advise believers to conduct themselves when facing hostility?
options: Be wise as serpents and harmless as doves
questions.correctAnswer: Be wise as serpents and harmless as doves
questions.explanation: Verse 16 teaches the balance of shrewdness and innocence as believers face opposition, encouraging prudence and gentleness in their witness.

questions.question: What instruction does Matthew 10 give about how to treat those who receive the disciples?
options: He who receives you receives me and the One who sent me
questions.correctAnswer: He who receives you receives me and the One who sent me
questions.explanation: Verse 40 emphasizes the spiritual significance of hospitality toward God's messengers, linking it directly to accepting Christ and God the Father.

questions.question: According to Matthew 10, what is the reward for giving even a cup of cold water to a disciple?
options: He shall in no wise lose his reward
It is a small act with no reward
questions.correctAnswer: He shall in no wise lose his reward
questions.explanation: Verse 42 affirms that even simple acts of kindness to believers in Jesus' name are seen and rewarded by God, encouraging generosity and service.

questions.question: How does Matthew 10 describe the relationship between disciple and master when facing rejection?
options: The disciple is not above the master; both may be rejected
The disciple will be honored more than the master
The master protects the disciple from rejection
Rejection is only for the disciple
questions.correctAnswer: The disciple is not above the master; both may be rejected
questions.explanation: Verses 24-25 show that disciples share in the same treatment as their master, including rejection, teaching humility and readiness for hardship.

questions.question: What does Matthew 10 say about enduring to the end amidst hatred for Christ's name?
options: He that endures to the end shall be saved
Avoid situations where you might be hated
Hate is a sign of failure
questions.correctAnswer: He that endures to the end shall be saved
questions.explanation: Verse 22 encourages perseverance despite hatred, promising salvation for those who remain faithful through trials.

questions.question: True or False: Matthew 10 teaches that Jesus came to bring peace on earth without any conflict.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 34 states that Jesus did not come to send peace but a sword, indicating that His message will cause division even among close family.

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 10, God is aware even of the smallest details of our lives, such as the number of hairs on our head.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 30 teaches God's intimate knowledge of believers, reassuring them of His constant care and presence.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Matthew 10 says, 'Freely ye have received, freely ______.'
questions.correctAnswer: give
questions.explanation: Verse 8 commands that since the disciples received gifts freely from Jesus, they should also give freely to others, highlighting generosity in ministry.

questions.question: A believer is conflicted about leaving a city when persecuted. What guidance does Matthew 10 provide?
options: Flee to another city when persecuted
Stay and face persecution without moving
questions.correctAnswer: Flee to another city when persecuted
questions.explanation: Verse 23 advises believers to flee to another city if persecuted, indicating wisdom in preserving life and continuing the mission.

hard.title: Matthew Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Matthew Chapter 10.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the mission Jesus gave to the twelve disciples in Matthew 10?
options: To preach to the Gentiles and Samaritans
To go to the lost sheep of Israel, heal the sick, and cast out demons
To establish new synagogues in every city
To collect offerings for the temple
questions.correctAnswer: To go to the lost sheep of Israel, heal the sick, and cast out demons
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:5-8 instructs the disciples to go only to the lost sheep of Israel and to perform miraculous healings and exorcisms as proof of the kingdom's arrival.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus instructing the disciples to take no gold, silver, or brass for their journey in Matthew 10:9-10?
options: It reflects a reliance on God's provision and hospitality of others
It indicates a rejection of all material wealth permanently
It suggests that they should earn money through manual labor
It is a symbolic act of humility before the Pharisees
questions.correctAnswer: It reflects a reliance on God's provision and hospitality of others
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:9-10 emphasizes that the disciples should trust in God and the kindness of those they minister to, reflecting a nomadic prophetic tradition.

questions.question: In Matthew 10:16, Jesus uses a metaphor describing his disciples as 'sheep in the midst of wolves.' Which Old Testament imagery does this most closely echo?
options: Psalm 23's depiction of the Lord as shepherd
Genesis 37's story of Joseph and his brothers
Isaiah 11's prophecy about the wolf dwelling with the lamb
questions.correctAnswer: Isaiah 11's prophecy about the wolf dwelling with the lamb
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:16 contrasts the vulnerability of disciples with the hostile environment, reminiscent of Isaiah 11's imagery where predators and prey coexist, highlighting the tension between peace and danger.

questions.question: What does the Greek word translated 'harmless' in Matthew 10:16 imply about the disciples' conduct?
questions.correctAnswer: Innocence and guilelessness
questions.explanation: The Greek term used denotes being 'without malice or deceit,' instructing disciples to be wise but morally pure despite hostility (Matthew 10:16).

questions.question: According to Matthew 10:17-18, what hardships will the disciples face, and what purpose do these hardships serve?
options: They will be physically harmed but not imprisoned; to test their faith
They will face trials before councils and kings; serving as a testimony against them and the Gentiles
They will be exiled from Israel; to spread the gospel worldwide
They will face famine and poverty; to develop humility
questions.correctAnswer: They will face trials before councils and kings; serving as a testimony against them and the Gentiles
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:17-18 describes persecution as both suffering and a witness to unbelievers, fulfilling prophetic roles of the suffering servant.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: In Matthew 10:20, Jesus teaches that when the disciples speak under persecution, it is not they who speak, but ________.
questions.correctAnswer: the Spirit of your Father
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:20 highlights the divine inspiration given to disciples during persecution, indicating the Spirit’s active role in their witness.

questions.question: In the context of Matthew 10, how does the command to 'shake off the dust of your feet' (verse 14) relate to Jewish customs and symbolism?
options: It symbolized leaving behind impurity and judgment on those rejecting the message
It was a ritual for blessing the ground
It indicated that the disciples were to clean themselves physically
It instructed disciples to return to Jerusalem immediately
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolized leaving behind impurity and judgment on those rejecting the message
questions.explanation: Shaking off dust was a symbolic act of disassociating from those who rejected the gospel, implying their culpability (Matthew 10:14; cf. Acts 13:51).

questions.question: What literary device is primarily used in Matthew 10:38-39 where Jesus speaks of taking up one's cross and losing life to find it?
questions.correctAnswer: Paradox
questions.explanation: The statements present paradoxical truths: losing life to find it, emphasizing the cost and reward of discipleship (Matthew 10:38-39).

questions.question: True or False: According to Matthew 10:34, Jesus came to bring peace to the earth.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:34 explicitly states Jesus did not come to bring peace but a sword, indicating division even within families due to differing allegiances.

questions.question: Which Old Testament figure is alluded to in Matthew 10:25 when Jesus mentions being called Beelzebub?
options: The master of the house called Beelzebub
questions.correctAnswer: The master of the house called Beelzebub
questions.explanation: Beelzebub was a Philistine deity referred to in 2 Kings 1:2-3, used here to illustrate the slander Jesus and his followers would endure (Matthew 10:25).

questions.question: How does Matthew 10:32-33 emphasize the theme of confession and denial in relation to eternal consequences?
options: Confession before men results in confession before God; denial leads to denial before God
Confession guarantees wealth; denial leads to poverty
Confession brings immediate miracles; denial brings curses
Confession means social acceptance; denial means rejection
questions.correctAnswer: Confession before men results in confession before God; denial leads to denial before God
questions.explanation: These verses highlight the cosmic significance of public confession or denial of Christ, linking earthly actions to heavenly judgment.

questions.question: What does Matthew 10:29-31 teach about God's providence using the example of sparrows?
options: God values even the smallest creatures and knows details of our lives
Sparrows symbolize enemies to be overcome
God only cares for humans, not animals
questions.correctAnswer: God values even the smallest creatures and knows details of our lives
questions.explanation: The metaphor of sparrows shows God’s intimate knowledge and care, encouraging believers not to fear (Matthew 10:29-31).

questions.question: According to Matthew 10:40-41, what is the reward for receiving a prophet or a righteous person in their name?
options: They shall receive the prophet's or righteous man's reward
They will be made rulers in Israel
They will gain wealth and fame
They will be exempt from judgment
questions.correctAnswer: They shall receive the prophet's or righteous man's reward
questions.explanation: Welcoming God's messengers results in sharing in their blessings and rewards (Matthew 10:40-41).

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'freely ye have received, freely give' in Matthew 10:8 in the context of first-century Jewish teaching and rabbinic traditions?
options: It contrasts with the common practice of charging for healing and teaching
It commands disciples to avoid all forms of generosity
It instructs disciples to perform miracles only for payment
It is a call to accumulate wealth through ministry
questions.correctAnswer: It contrasts with the common practice of charging for healing and teaching
questions.explanation: This phrase emphasizes the grace-based nature of ministry, differing from rabbinic norms where teaching often required payment (Matthew 10:8).

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Matthew 10:23 advises the disciples that when persecuted in one city, they should ________.
questions.correctAnswer: flee to another city
questions.explanation: Jesus instructs the disciples to avoid prolonged persecution by moving to another city, indicating strategic mission work (Matthew 10:23).

theological.title: Matthew Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Matthew Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What authority did Jesus give to His twelve disciples in Matthew 10?
options: Power over unclean spirits to cast them out and to heal sickness and disease
questions.correctAnswer: Power over unclean spirits to cast them out and to heal sickness and disease
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:1 records Jesus giving His disciples power over unclean spirits and to heal all sickness and disease. This reflects God's authority over evil and suffering (cf. Luke 9:1, Mark 3:15, Acts 10:38, Isaiah 53:4-5).

questions.question: Which of the following apostles was known as "Peter" according to Matthew 10?
questions.correctAnswer: Simon
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:2 names Simon as the one called Peter, highlighting his role among the twelve. Peter’s prominent role is also affirmed in John 1:42, Luke 6:14, and Acts 2:14.

questions.question: To whom did Jesus instruct the twelve apostles NOT to go during their initial mission?
questions.correctAnswer: Gentiles and Samaritans
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:5 explicitly commands the apostles not to go to Gentiles or Samaritans but rather to the lost sheep of Israel, indicating the priority of Israel in God's redemptive plan (cf. Romans 11:1-2, John 1:11, Acts 13:46, Romans 15:8).

questions.question: What message were the disciples to preach according to Matthew 10?
options: The kingdom of heaven is at hand
Repent for the kingdom is past
The temple is the only place of worship
questions.correctAnswer: The kingdom of heaven is at hand
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:7 directs the disciples to preach that the kingdom of heaven is near, emphasizing the inaugurated eschatology of Jesus’ ministry (cf. Mark 1:15, Luke 10:9, Matthew 4:17, Isaiah 61:1-2).

questions.question: Which of the following instructions did Jesus give concerning material provisions for the disciples?
options: Do not carry gold, silver, or copper in your money belts
Take extra food and money for the journey
Wear two coats and carry shoes
questions.correctAnswer: Do not carry gold, silver, or copper in your money belts
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:9 instructs the disciples not to carry gold, silver, or copper, teaching reliance on God's provision and hospitality of others (cf. Luke 22:35-36, Deuteronomy 8:3, Philippians 4:19, Psalm 37:25).

questions.question: How were the disciples to respond if a city or house did not receive them or their message?
options: Shake off the dust from their feet as a testimony against them
Stay until they accepted the message
questions.correctAnswer: Shake off the dust from their feet as a testimony against them
questions.explanation: In Matthew 10:14, Jesus commands the disciples to shake the dust from their feet when rejected, symbolizing separation from those who refuse the gospel (cf. Acts 13:51, Luke 9:5, Deuteronomy 29:19, Ezekiel 33:8).

questions.question: What metaphor does Jesus use to describe the disciples' situation amid opposition?
questions.correctAnswer: Sheep among wolves
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:16 depicts the disciples as sheep in the midst of wolves, illustrating vulnerability and the need for wisdom and innocence (cf. Ezekiel 34:31, John 10:12-13, Psalm 23:1-4, Acts 20:29-30).

questions.question: According to Matthew 10, what will happen to the disciples when they are delivered to councils and kings?
options: They will be given the words to speak by the Spirit at that hour
They must prepare their own defense
They will be abandoned by God
questions.correctAnswer: They will be given the words to speak by the Spirit at that hour
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:19-20 promises the Spirit will speak through the disciples when persecuted, affirming divine empowerment and guidance (cf. Luke 12:11-12, Acts 4:31, John 14:26, Isaiah 59:21).

questions.question: What is the warning Jesus gives about family relationships in Matthew 10?
options: Family members may betray one another because of Him
Families will be united in faith without conflict
Only unbelievers will oppose the disciples
questions.correctAnswer: Family members may betray one another because of Him
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:21-22 reveals that allegiance to Christ may cause division within families, reflecting the cost of discipleship (cf. Luke 12:51-53, Micah 7:6, Mark 13:12, 1 Corinthians 16:13).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about the disciple in relation to the master in Matthew 10?
options: The disciple is not above the master
The disciple will be greater than the master
The disciple and master are equal
questions.correctAnswer: The disciple is not above the master
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:24 teaches that discipleship involves sharing in the same experiences as the master, including suffering, underscoring humility and imitation of Christ (cf. John 13:16, Philippians 2:5-8, 1 Peter 2:21, Hebrews 13:7).

questions.question: What does Jesus say about fearing those who can kill the body but not the soul?
options: Do not fear them, but fear God who can destroy both soul and body in hell
Fear those who can kill the body more than God
questions.correctAnswer: Do not fear them, but fear God who can destroy both soul and body in hell
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:28 contrasts fearing mortal enemies with fearing God who has authority over eternal destiny, emphasizing God's sovereign judgment (cf. Hebrews 10:31, Luke 12:5, Ecclesiastes 12:13, Revelation 20:14-15).

questions.question: What does Jesus affirm about the value of individuals compared to sparrows?
options: They are of much greater value than many sparrows
They are less valuable than sparrows
They have the same value as sparrows
questions.correctAnswer: They are of much greater value than many sparrows
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:31 states humans are more valuable than sparrows, underscoring God's intimate care and providence (cf. Psalm 8:4-5, Luke 12:6-7, Job 31:13-15, Isaiah 40:11).

questions.question: What will happen to those who confess Jesus before men according to Matthew 10?
options: Jesus will confess them before His Father in heaven
They will be denied before men
They will be rejected by God
They will receive earthly rewards only
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus will confess them before His Father in heaven
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:32 promises that those who openly confess Christ will be acknowledged by Him before God, linking confession with salvation (cf. Romans 10:9, Luke 12:8, 1 John 4:15, Revelation 3:5).

questions.question: According to Matthew 10, what is the nature of the peace Jesus brings?
options: Peace that ends all conflict immediately
questions.correctAnswer: Not peace but a sword
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:34 states Jesus came to bring division and conflict rather than worldly peace, emphasizing the cost of discipleship and the radical nature of His kingdom (cf. Luke 12:51, John 16:33, Romans 5:1, Ephesians 6:12).

questions.question: What is required of one who would be worthy of Jesus according to Matthew 10?
options: To love Him more than father, mother, son, or daughter
To avoid suffering at all costs
questions.correctAnswer: To love Him more than father, mother, son, or daughter
questions.explanation: Matthew 10:37 stresses that loyalty to Christ must supersede familial ties, reflecting the primacy of allegiance to God (cf. Luke 14:26, Deuteronomy 6:5, John 14:15, 1 Corinthians 8:3).
